trans-unit.source: Create Stream Analytics Job
trans-unit.target: Create Stream Analytics Job

trans-unit.source: Creates a new Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Creates a new Stream Analytics job in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Stream Analytics and how you can use it, see <externalLink><linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=517303</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Stream Analytics and how you can use it, see <externalLink><linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=517303</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Before you can run this operation, you must create an Azure subscription and obtain the subscription identifier.
trans-unit.target: Before you can run this operation, you must create an Azure subscription and obtain the subscription identifier.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain the subscription identifier on the <ui>Settings</ui> page of the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain the subscription identifier on the <ui>Settings</ui> page of the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Create Stream Analytics Job</ui> request is specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Create Stream Analytics Job</ui> request is specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: For headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Stream Analytics jobs, see <externalLink><linkText>Common parameters and headers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/8d088ecc-26eb-42e9-8acc-fe929ed33563</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Stream Analytics jobs, see <externalLink><linkText>Common parameters and headers</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/8d088ecc-26eb-42e9-8acc-fe929ed33563</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <externalLink><linkText>Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790557.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <externalLink><linkText>Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790557.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: https://management.azure.com/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourcegroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/Microsoft.StreamAnalytics/streamingjobs/{job-name}?api-version={api-version}
trans-unit.target: https://management.azure.com/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourcegroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/Microsoft.StreamAnalytics/streamingjobs/{job-name}?api-version={api-version}

trans-unit.source: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: Replace {subscription-id} with your subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Replace {resource-group-name} with the name of the resource group that this job will belong to.
trans-unit.target: Replace {resource-group-name} with the name of the resource group that this job will belong to.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating resource groups, see <externalLink><linkText>Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating resource groups, see <externalLink><linkText>Using resource groups to manage your Azure resources</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/azure-preview-portal-using-resource-groups/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Replace {job-name} with the name that you want to assign to the Stream Analytics job that you are creating.
trans-unit.target: Replace {job-name} with the name that you want to assign to the Stream Analytics job that you are creating.

trans-unit.source: The job name is case insensitive and must be unique among all inputs in the job, containing only numbers, letters, and hyphens.
trans-unit.target: The job name is case insensitive and must be unique among all inputs in the job, containing only numbers, letters, and hyphens.

trans-unit.source: It must be 3 to 63 characters long.
trans-unit.target: It must be 3 to 63 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Replace {api-version} with 2015-06-01 in the URI.
trans-unit.target: Replace {api-version} with 2015-06-01 in the URI.

trans-unit.source: JSON
trans-unit.target: JSON

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: The value of <system>location</system> must be a supported Azure Stream Analytics location.
trans-unit.target: The value of <system>location</system> must be a supported Azure Stream Analytics location.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>List all of the available geo-locations</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790540.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>List all of the available geo-locations</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn790540.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This element contains a collection of one or more name/value pairs that describe a tag.
trans-unit.target: This element contains a collection of one or more name/value pairs that describe a tag.

trans-unit.source: The value can be null for a tag.
trans-unit.target: The value can be null for a tag.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: This element specifies the SKU being purchased for this Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: This element specifies the SKU being purchased for this Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: For the preview release, the value of the name property in <system>sku</system> must be Standard.
trans-unit.target: For the preview release, the value of the name property in <system>sku</system> must be Standard.

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: Events that arrive within the time window specified for <system>eventsOutOfOrderMaxDelayInSeconds</system> will be reordered automatically.
trans-unit.target: Events that arrive within the time window specified for <system>eventsOutOfOrderMaxDelayInSeconds</system> will be reordered automatically.

trans-unit.source: Events that arrive outside the delay window will be dropped or adjusted based on the value selected.
trans-unit.target: Events that arrive outside the delay window will be dropped or adjusted based on the value selected.

trans-unit.source: Values supported: Adjust, Drop.
trans-unit.target: Values supported: Adjust, Drop.

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: This element specifies the time window (in seconds) within which events should be automatically reordered.
trans-unit.target: This element specifies the time window (in seconds) within which events should be automatically reordered.

trans-unit.source: The delay specified will directly affect the job latency.
trans-unit.target: The delay specified will directly affect the job latency.

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: This element identifies the specific country/region associated with the data processed by a streaming job.
trans-unit.target: This element identifies the specific country/region associated with the data processed by a streaming job.

trans-unit.source: The value determines the formats used with dates and other types.
trans-unit.target: The value determines the formats used with dates and other types.

trans-unit.source: For example, with a <system>dataLocale</system> value of fr-FR, the date “10/11/2015” is interpreted as Tuesday, November 10, 2015.
trans-unit.target: For example, with a <system>dataLocale</system> value of fr-FR, the date “10/11/2015” is interpreted as Tuesday, November 10, 2015.

trans-unit.source: The value is an Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) language tag that names a <externalLink><linkText>specific culture</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.globalization.cultureinfo.createspecificculture(v=vs.110).aspx</linkUri></externalLink> supported by Microsoft .NET.
trans-unit.target: The value is an Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) language tag that names a <externalLink><linkText>specific culture</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.globalization.cultureinfo.createspecificculture(v=vs.110).aspx</linkUri></externalLink> supported by Microsoft .NET.

trans-unit.source: The default value is en-US.
trans-unit.target: The default value is en-US.

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: This element specifies an array of one or more inputs to the streaming job.
trans-unit.target: This element specifies an array of one or more inputs to the streaming job.

trans-unit.source: An input is a stream-processing component that feeds a job with streaming or reference input data from a resource that is outside Stream Analytics; for example, Azure Blob storage or Azure Service Bus Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: An input is a stream-processing component that feeds a job with streaming or reference input data from a resource that is outside Stream Analytics; for example, Azure Blob storage or Azure Service Bus Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Each Job requires at least one streaming input, and may contain one or more reference data inputs.
trans-unit.target: Each Job requires at least one streaming input, and may contain one or more reference data inputs.

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: A transformation is a stream-processing component that performs a query on one or more incoming streams.
trans-unit.target: A transformation is a stream-processing component that performs a query on one or more incoming streams.

trans-unit.source: A transformation is described by a transformation query in the JSON body of the resource.
trans-unit.target: A transformation is described by a transformation query in the JSON body of the resource.

trans-unit.source: Each job may have only one transformation.
trans-unit.target: Each job may have only one transformation.

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: This element specifies an array of one or more outputs to the streaming job.
trans-unit.target: This element specifies an array of one or more outputs to the streaming job.

trans-unit.source: An output is a stream-processing component that pushes the output of a streaming job to a resource that is outside Stream Analytics; for example, Azure Blob storage, SQL Database, or Azure Service Bus Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: An output is a stream-processing component that pushes the output of a streaming job to a resource that is outside Stream Analytics; for example, Azure Blob storage, SQL Database, or Azure Service Bus Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: Status code: 201 or 200
trans-unit.target: Status code: 201 or 200

trans-unit.source: For security reasons, secrets and passwords are not returned in the response.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons, secrets and passwords are not returned in the response.

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Notes
trans-unit.target: Notes

trans-unit.source: This element specifies a URI that refers directly to the Stream Analytics job just created.
trans-unit.target: This element specifies a URI that refers directly to the Stream Analytics job just created.

trans-unit.source: Region in which to create the streaming job
trans-unit.target: Region in which to create the streaming job

trans-unit.source: This element is not returned if tags were not included in the request.
trans-unit.target: This element is not returned if tags were not included in the request.

trans-unit.source: This is a read-only property, set by the service when the streaming job is created.
trans-unit.target: This is a read-only property, set by the service when the streaming job is created.

trans-unit.source: It is returned in <system>PUT</system> and <system>GET</system> response bodies.
trans-unit.target: It is returned in <system>PUT</system> and <system>GET</system> response bodies.

trans-unit.source: The provisioningSate field has three terminal states: <embeddedLabel>Succeeded</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Failed</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Canceled</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The provisioningSate field has three terminal states: <embeddedLabel>Succeeded</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>Failed</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>Canceled</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: If the resource returns no provisioningState, it is assumed to be <embeddedLabel>Succeeded</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: If the resource returns no provisioningState, it is assumed to be <embeddedLabel>Succeeded</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the current execution state of the streaming job.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the current execution state of the streaming job.

trans-unit.source: Client can use start/stop resource actions (POST) to change the state.
trans-unit.target: Client can use start/stop resource actions (POST) to change the state.

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the job should start producing output at a given timestamp or at the point when the job starts.
trans-unit.target: Specifies if the job should start producing output at a given timestamp or at the point when the job starts.

trans-unit.source: Value may be JobStartTime, CustomTime, or LastOutputEventTime
trans-unit.target: Value may be JobStartTime, CustomTime, or LastOutputEventTime

trans-unit.source: The earliest timestamp of events from inputs that this job processes.
trans-unit.target: The earliest timestamp of events from inputs that this job processes.

trans-unit.source: This is not a start time for the job itself.
trans-unit.target: This is not a start time for the job itself.

trans-unit.source: Police on what to do for events arriving out of order.
trans-unit.target: Police on what to do for events arriving out of order.

trans-unit.source: Value in seconds
trans-unit.target: Value in seconds

trans-unit.source: Value in seconds
trans-unit.target: Value in seconds

trans-unit.source: The value is an ISO-8601 formatted Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time stamp that indicates when the streaming job was created.
trans-unit.target: The value is an ISO-8601 formatted Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time stamp that indicates when the streaming job was created.

trans-unit.source: A list of one or more inputs.
trans-unit.target: A list of one or more inputs.

trans-unit.source: Returns the value of the current transformation component of the stream job.
trans-unit.target: Returns the value of the current transformation component of the stream job.

trans-unit.source: A list of one or more outputs.
trans-unit.target: A list of one or more outputs.

trans-unit.source: This element identifies the specific country/region associated with the data processed by a streaming job.
trans-unit.target: This element identifies the specific country/region associated with the data processed by a streaming job.

trans-unit.source: The value determines the formats used with dates and other types.
trans-unit.target: The value determines the formats used with dates and other types.

trans-unit.source: For example, with a <system>dataLocale</system> value of fr-FR, the date “10/11/2015” is interpreted as Tuesday, November 10, 2015.
trans-unit.target: For example, with a <system>dataLocale</system> value of fr-FR, the date “10/11/2015” is interpreted as Tuesday, November 10, 2015.

trans-unit.source: The value is an IETF language tag that names a <externalLink><linkText>specific culture</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.globalization.cultureinfo.createspecificculture(v=vs.110).aspx</linkUri></externalLink> supported by .NET.
trans-unit.target: The value is an IETF language tag that names a <externalLink><linkText>specific culture</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.globalization.cultureinfo.createspecificculture(v=vs.110).aspx</linkUri></externalLink> supported by .NET.

trans-unit.source: The default value is en-US.
trans-unit.target: The default value is en-US.
